title: The Great Debate
description: Kotter arranges a debate between the Sweathogs and the debate team.

title: Basket Case
description: Kotter is pressured to give Boom-Boom a passing grade on his exam, which he fails, so that he can continue to play on the basketball team.

title: Welcome Back (Pilot)
description: Gabriel Kotter is a teacher in Brooklyn, New York who ends up teaching at his old alma mater: Buchanan High School. He has been assigned to teach the remedial students, better known as the Sweathogs, a group to which he used to belong.

title: Whodunit?
description: Rosalie fakes shes pregnant in order to make the sweathogs confess she did not fool around with them.

title: The Election
description: Vinnie runs for class president.

title: No More Mr. Nice Guy
description: Mr. Woodman and Mr. Kotter reverse roles. Mr. Woodman starts being nice to the sweathogs, and Mr. Kotter starts getting mean to them.

title: Classroom Marriage
description: Freddie and Vernajean wants to quit school to get married. So Mr. Kotter has them act out a marriage in class.

title: One of Our Sweathogs Is Missing
description: Epstein loses a fight to Todd Ludlow, he feels so ashamed about it he runs away.

title: Mr. Kotter, Teacher
description: Mr. Kotter is suspended because Mr. Woodman doesn't like his teaching methods.

title: The Reunion
description: Mr. Kotter dreads an old successful classmate coming to dinner.

title: Barbarino's Girl
description: Mr. Kotter talks Judy into tutoring Barbarino. The two eventually become friends, but Barbarino doesn't want the other Sweathogs to know about it.

title: California Dreamin'
description: A new girl sweathog arrives and has all the boy sweathogs in heat.

title: Arrividerci, Arnold
description: When it is announced that Horshack has graduated out of the Sweathogs and into regular classes, Kotter instructs the remaining Sweathogs to shun him so that he can meet people in his new classes.

title: The Longest Weekend
description: Kotter begins to behave erratically when he learns that Julie will be going on a weekend ski trip, marking the first time that they've been separated since their marriage.

title: The Sit-In
description: Instead of the planned food fight, Kotter convinces the Sweathogs to stage an all-night classroom sit-in to protest the school's serving of liver for lunch.

title: Follow the Leader: Part 1
description: Sweathogs tapping at the window for breakfast, coupled with the love, attention and time Mr. Kotter lavishes upon his students finally drive the neglected Julie to leave Gabe. Meanwhile, Kotter's classroom lesson on democracy goes awry when the Sweathogs vote Barbarino out and Freddie in as their new leader, provoking the rejected Vinnie to drop out of school.

title: Follow the Leader: Part 2
description: Mr. Kotter seeks to reconcile with Julie, Freddie's leadership of the Sweathogs evokes the adage of absolute power corrupting absolutely and Barbarino weighs humility versus being a high school dropout and door-to-door Tidy-Didy cleanser salesman.

title: Dr. Epstein, I Presume
description: Epstein goes to the guidance counselor to talk about being a veterinarian. She says he is not smart enough and he should look for a career in manual labor. So he gives his animals Kotter because he thinks he can't take care of them anymore.

title: One Flu Over the Cuckoo's Nest
description: A flu epidemic requires several advanced students to join Kotter's class, where they quickly outshine his struggling students. Kotter boosts the battered self-confidence of his Sweathogs by demonstrating that not all smarts are book smarts.

title: The Telethon
description: Arnold and Mr. Kotter persuade the Sweathogs to hold a telethon for much needed school supplies.

title: Kotter Makes Good
description: Mr. Woodman gleefully informs Kotter that there are no records of his having completed his senior exams, so Kotter has to take the tests alongside his Sweathogs, who commit to tutoring him.

title: Father Vinnie
description: Vinnie's 87 year old grandmother is in the hospital possibly on her death bed. When his grandmother dies he decides he must honor her death bed request of him and become a priest. He now walks the hallways of Buchanan telling everyone he loves them and organizing prayer meetings. But what is he to do when faced with an after school date with Bambi? Kotter and the rest of the guys must convince Vinnie that he just isn't cut out to be a priest.

title: Inherit the Halibut
description: When the Sweathogs' treasury money is stolen, all fingers point to Washington who has just purchased a new bike.

title: The Fight
description: The Sweathogs have a series of disagreements between each other and stop talking to each other.

title: The Museum
description: The Sweathogs go on a field trip to a museum and meet its mysterious curator.

title: Sweathog, Nebraska Style
description: Julie's sister from Nebraska visits and enrolls at Buchanan. She wants to be in Gabe's class and develops a fondness for Epstein...much to Julie's dismay.

title: Hello Ms. Chips
description: A student teacher joins Kotter's class only to find that normal teaching methods don't work with the Sweathogs. Then she adopts Kotter's style only to find out that it doesn't work for her.

title: Horshack vs. Carvelli
description: Horshack is out to prove his manhood by fighting Carvelli in the boxing ring.

title: Sweathog Clinic for the Cure of Smoking
description: The Sweathogs try to convince Epstein to give up his smoking habit.

title: Hark, the Sweatkings
description: To get into the Christmas spirit, the Sweathogs give a homeless man a shave and a new suit. But after he shows up at the Kotter's Christmas party wearing his old clothes, he tells them he's a bum, but he's a happy bum.

title: A Love Story
description: Juan's younger sister is enrolled in Kotter's class and Arnold is immediately attracted to her, but so is Vinnie, and this drives Juan crazy. Freddie is also in a romantic mood and Kotter sees it as an opportunity to teach the Sweathogs about love.

title: Caruso's Way
description: Barbarino wants revenge after a gym teacher slaps him in the face.

title: Sweatgate Scandal
description: The Sweathogs join the school newspaper and investigate the break-in at the principal's office. During their investigation, they discover some shady happenings at Buchanan High School.

title: Chicken a la Kotter
description: Gabe finds himself short of cash. So he gets a job but he doesn't Julie what it is. She sees him go out with a suitcase. She then confronts him and he opens the suitcase and she sees what's in it; a chicken suit. He got a job at a chicken restaurant that requires him to wear a chicken suit. And when his students and Woodman come in, he wonders if it's worth it.

title: I Wonder Who's Kissing Gabe Now
description: Epstein spies a sexy art teacher kiss Kotter and assumes that Kotter is cheating on Julie.

title: Brother, Can You Spare a Million?
What a Move
description: The Kotters are looking for a new apartment and having no luck. Juan has an answer to their problem. His Uncle owns a building in a good neighborhood at the right price. The gang helps the Kotters move in and everything seems to be going great...until Moe Epstein tells them that there are no babies allowed.

title: A Sweathog Christmas Special
description: Merriment, mistletoe and menorahs are the beginnings of a Merry Christmas celebration with the Sweathogs and Gabe and Julie Kotter.

title: Meet Your New Teacher: Batteries Not Included
Epstein's Term Paper
description: The sweathogs purchase term papers from a couple of local hoods. Kotter recognizes Epstein's paper as one he himself had handed in years ago.

title: There's No Business: Part 1
description: The Sweathogs convince Gabe to audition at a local hot spot, never expecting him to succeed, but after Mr. Charnoff a slick agent gets through with him, it's goodbye teacher, hello show biz. First of a two-part episode.

title: There's No Business: Part 2
description: Kotter is a success at being a comedian but it is putting a strain on his marriage and his relationship with the Sweathogs. Second of a two-part episode.

title: What Goes Up
description: Freddie is prescribed painkillers to treat a nagging injury he suffered playing basketball ... and soon becomes hooked. His friends become concerned about Freddie's increasingly scary behavior, but "Boom-Boom" tries to brush them off - after all, it's just "vitamins." What becomes even more scary is that Horshack blindly believes his friend's explanation, even though it becomes clear that Freddie needs help before something goes horribly wrong.

title: Class Encounters of the Carvelli Kind
Don't Come Up and See Me Sometime
Once Upon a Ledge
description: A new girl at Buchanan High contemplates suicide after having a hard time making friends.

title: Frog Day Afternoon
description: The students are told as part of their biology requirement they're going to have to dissect a frog. And Arnold refuses to do it. He even protests by trying to take the frogs. He is told if he doesn't do it, he will get a failing grade and he's asking the other Sweathogs for support.

title: Bride and Gloom
description: Barbarino's wedding is coming up very soon and he's getting cold feet.

title: Come Back, Little Arnold
description: Terrified of going out with pretty Mary Johnson, Horshack believes he can find courage in a bottle.

title: The Sweat Smell of Success
description: Epstein is assigned to the school paper and changes it from a dull, lifeless weekly to a gossipy, sensationalist money-maker -- almost losing his friends in the process.

title: I'm Okay, But You're Not
description: Beau's sweet-talking to Mr. Woodman backfires when the guys accuse him of bad-mouthing them.

title: The Breadwinners
description: Epstein has a job prospect, but Washington unknowingly takes the job before Epstein gets a chance to interview. Their friendship is in danger, and they decide to settle their differences through a fight at the local spa.
